page.title: 01MR PATE FAIRNILEE FARM
page.content: During one wednesday afternoon we went to Mr Pates farm and also went into his house to talk. We had already phoned Mr Pate for permission. Mr Pate's farm is called Fairnilee it is on the road to Peebles. Mr Pate has eight hundred and sixty acres of land, comprised of, one hundred and fifty acres of woodland, two hundred acres of hill grazing (rough). and five hundred and sixty acres of arable land. At the farm there is a public telephone and a post box. There are also four more cottages on the estate, two of them are rented, one to a retired lady and the other to a young couple and a baby. On the farm there are two full time and a few part time workers. One of the workers has worked there for twenty-five years.
